snippet: Leo Tolstoy’s spouse, Sophia, wrote two novellas in reply to his story “The Kreutzer Sonata,” works that will be included in “The Kreutzer Sonata Variations,” from Yale University Press.
abstract: Sophia Andreevna Tolstoy, long-suffering wife of Leo Tolstoy, has her say in The Kreutzer Sonata Variations, from Yale University Press; work combines two novellas written by Sophia, tranlated by Michael R Katz, adding to recent work that has emerged appraising Tolstoy's wife as figure in her own right.
lead_paragraph: Leo Tolstoy’s spouse, Sophia, wrote two novellas in reply to his story “The Kreutzer Sonata,” works that will be included in “The Kreutzer Sonata Variations,” from Yale University Press.

headline.seo: ‘Kreutzer Sonata Variations’ Has a Scorned Wife’s Rebuttal
headline.main: More Than a Century Later, Sophia Tolstoy Has Her Say
